comments.body: Just use mending
Mending isnt easy to get ive only had mending once and ive been playing for 8 years i get it though

You are aware mending is from villagers, right? you get a librarian villager and then work till you get mending. there are a lot of videos online for this sort of thing. I promise you it's worth the effort

A lot of things in Minecraft is about weighing the pros and cons. Do you use iron for a pick or a bucket? Do you give the wheat to the sheep or the cows? More famously, do you use an elytra or use a chestplate? An elytra gives air mobility while a chestplate gives defense. Netherite armor gives you stronger tools and armor that are fire resistant BUT it's rare and highly expensive to repair normally, encouraging you to find alternatives (only using netherite when in the nether or getting mending).

Yes this would be a parent cause you would mosst likely get a bone from a skeleton giving you monster hunter unless you found one in a temple then you could kill a mob with a bone which would give you the two achievements at once.....

Thats not how bad minecraft physics are, think yourself, rubbing 2 stones on wood lights it, that is basically what flint and steel is. Its not possible to light a human by rubbing 2 stones on him. Just light the block below the entity and the entity will catch fire.

mubash, then why are we able to use it on stone in game? How do we start a fire on stone with only flint and steel?
I understand your point but the physics of a game can't be perfect nor applied to every small detail, otherwise it would become to complexe to play and players wouldn't play anymore (for that we have real life xD).
From what is already ingame, if an entity goes through fire set from flint and steel on stone, it will catch fire. It is how it is and it works, it's simple, great.
What we're asking is being able to light an entity directly on fire by clicking on it. For me it's mostly because it is near impossible to do it on the ground when there is grass everywhere. That or change how grass is set on fire, for exemple, from whatever side you light grass on fire, left, right, top,.. it could be set to always burn on top or even when using flint and steel on grass, replace it by fire, something like that, there are many options that could be tested. Any other way would be better to how it is now, lighting grass from the side will start a fire on the block next to the gass :(
mubash, try it how it is now and you'll understand :/
Also they should only spawn on blocks found in the nether (except for glowstone and lava (except for striders)) like netherrack, nylium, nether bricks, ... etc

Hi! It looks like there's something very similar in subject, it's a list, has a previously rejected idea, is a bug or support issue, exists, or too general.  Check out this link (https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/articles/360004442111-Creating-Great-Ideas), search (https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/articles/360035667771-Making-Great-Searches-on-the-Feedback-Site-), & join existing threads in progress (we read ALL the comments).

who are you so wise in the ways of sciene

I think it would be cool if the reactor made a small bastion with friendly piglins when left clicked and had a function that allowed such piglins to not become zombies, it would give you a "hero of the village"- like effect and turn the piglins neutral, and they would give better deals. Though if you even touch the reactor, they become hostile (being that if the reactor breaks, the piglins zombify) and ambush you with the raid you mentioned a random time. Another thing you could do is.... blow them up, which causes a huge explosion from the reactor itself (like 20 tnt), turning the remaining blocks into assorted nether blocks and making trees warped/crimson. Also, the reactor explosion has a higher debris rate than the nether, being that it just made a huge, hot explosion, and would explain how debris came to be.
The Z Piglin Chief could drop a few netherite ingots. It would also be cool if when the raid started, a nether portal formed and the mobs came out of it.

Neat idea! I think that instead of ditching the time value entirely, maybe make it so its a mix of the two?

This would also help with taking damage from falling with Levitation 253, although the game now has the Slow Falling effect. This would only apply to mapmakers.

Maybe all of Minecraft's physics should be rewritten to be more accurate, compared to it's current system that appears to only use acceleration and friction.

I was thinking of all these arguments including the elytra kinetic damage when I was planning to post this tecnical ideas. But as great this idea is there are two issues that have to be concidered, 1 damage has to be scaled to allow for at least 20 damage to be taken at terminal velocity so falling deaths can stay consistant some way and two many systems have to be fixed for such a change to be possible becauce systems to detect fall damage would have to be accounted for and differentiation in impact forces have to be considered for horizontal and verticle directs. If horizontal directions were to be used for more realist impact physics, something like running into a wall with high speed will deal damage which would make for a funny death but might not be most favorable to desired minecraft game play.

That's what a snapshot is, which sometimes have new stuff, (Sometimes it's just technical or bug fixes), and they can sometimes add quite a lot! (Such as 15w14a....) But if you play bedrock edition, (iOS, Android, WIndows 10, Xbox One, Switch, and more), you can sign up for the beta on most devices. (If not, try the experimental features world toggle. It sometimes has new stuff! Keep in mind that these are unstable and may be very buggy, so proceed with caution, or you can use the built-in backup feature, (if you are on Java) or just copy your world.
